ans: 1. Authentication is the process of identifying the user through their unique identity(email/user-id) and password. On the other hand, Authorization is the process for checking the resource accessing privilege of an authenticated user. 2. Authentication of a user is done before determining his/her authorization of the resources(e.g. payment page, checkout page of a website).

ques: Why are you using firebase? What other options do you have to implement authentication?
ans:
We are using firebase for authentication and hosting purposes. Firebase is allowing the developers to identify the users using email/password, phone number and other identity providers like github, google, facebook, etc. It provides easier, more secure and trustworthy authentication system than our own created manual login and register system.
Other than firebase, we have Parse, Back4app, Heroku, Kuzzle, Deployd, Kinvey, Backendless, Pubnub, Kumulous, etc.

ques: What other services does firebase provide other than authentication?
ans:
Below are few other services of firebase:
1. Realtime database. 2.Remote configuration. 3. Cloud messaging. 4. Cloud functions. 5. Hosting. 6. Cloud Storage. 7. Firebase ml.
